intro: Pimpinella homblei, commonly known as the Himalayan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its morphology includes a slender stem and umbels of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pimpinella homblei is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
